intro: Silene luciliae, commonly known as the Lucilia's campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Silene luciliae has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in open areas such as cliffs and limestone soils.
